comments:
AspectJ produces stack traces including munged member names that confuse JDT
when clicking in the console to navigate to the appropriate line (it attempts to
interpret the class name).  Perhaps the parser could be corrected, or a hint
taken from the file/line number at the end of the trace line.  For example, in
the following, JDT attempts to find the class "util.OneAsMany.ajc" when parsing 
"util.OneAsMany.ajc$around$util_OneAsMany$1$b32733c6(OneAsMany.java:101)"

creating testContext
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.Error: testContext not closed
	at
aunit.samples.ManageTestContext.ajc$around$aunit_samples_ManageTestContext$2$ae3f2067(Run.java:110)
	at util.OneAsMany.ajc$around$util_OneAsMany$1$b32733c6(OneAsMany.java:101)
	at aunit.samples.Runner.run(Run.java:1)
	at aunit.samples.Run.main(Run.java:26)
